author: chaserxy
content:
is beaconcha.in's liveness chart correct? (https://beaconcha.in/charts/network_liveness) as far as I understand Gasper, whenever a boundary slot is missed, that epoch will have a liveness of 3 epochs, and the following epoch also. in the epoch after it can go back to 2 if it's only that one initial boundary slot missed.

(this doesn't apply to epochs close to the genesis because slot 0 is by definition proposed and finalized instantly, so even though epoch 1's and epoch 2's boundary slots were missed, it only introduces +1 epoch liveness at epoch 3. epoch 3's boundary justifies epoch 2, and epoch 4's finalizes epoch 2, so by epoch 4 we're back to a lag of 2 epochs (4 - 2 = 2).)

but there's also a missed boundary slot in epoch 5:
https://beaconcha.in/epoch/5
 which should increase that epoch's liveness to 3 epochs (last finalized epoch is epoch 2, 5 - 2 = 3). epoch 6 has a boundary block, which finalizes epoch 3, again leading to a liveness of 6 - 3 = 3 epochs.

author: ajsutton
content: Finalization happens at epoch transition with or without a block (assuming enough attestations were received in earlier blocks).

author: ajsutton
content: Though I may be misunderstanding exactly what this metric is trying to report on.

author: chaserxy
content: so far I thought their "liveness" means the distance between the current epoch and the last epoch with a finalized checkpoint. but now I'm less sure.

author: ajsutton
content: Missed blocks wouldn't affect that metric then and I'd say that's exactly what it's reporting and getting it right.
